title: Ticket #7223: CCB interferes with new negotiator auth sessions
description:
When we create a pre-negotiated security session in the negotiator from the schedd's capability -- and the CCB is used -- the negotiator creates a security session with this key. 

<192.168.2.85:9618?CCBID=XYZ.XYZ.XYZ.XYZ:9618%3faddrs%3dXYZ.XYZ.XYZ.XYZ-9618%26alias%3dflock.example.com#25188186212331&PrivNet=condor-login-56c47bcc47-8vr5n&addrs=192.168.2.85-9618&alias=condor-login-56c47bcc47-8vr5n&noUDP&sock=schedd_35_95e7_2>

A second later, the negotiator tries to contact the schedd. The daemon client code causes the SecMan code to look for a session named this: 

<192.168.2.85:9618?CCBID=XYZ.XYZ.XYZ.XYZ:9618%3faddrs%3dXYZ.XYZ.XYZ.XYZ-9618%26alias%3dflock.example.com#25188186212331&addrs=192.168.2.85-9618&alias=condor-login-56c47bcc47-8vr5n&noUDP&sock=schedd_35_95e7_2>

(Note that the PrivNet portion is missing)

Since the key is different, the cache lookup fails. An authorization handshake is tried and - in this case - fails.

I think this is a sinful string issue, so assigning to Todd Miller.
remarks:
2019-Aug-30 10:00:32 by bbockelm:
Updated the "broken version" to 8.9.3, given that this feature isn't out yet.

Note that this only affects things when the schedd is behind the CCB. I suspect that's an uncommon setup as it requires the startds to be on the public internet. The site that noticed the bug ultimately wasn't really affected because they had worker nodes behind the NAT and turned off the CCB for the schedd.

2019-Aug-30 13:59:11 by tlmiller:
I think it's a misfeature in DaemonClient --

https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/master/src/condor_daemon_client/daemon.cpp#L2110

-- which only bites us just now because we didn't use to use full Sinfuls for the session IDs (which caused other problems).

I'm guessing the easiest patch would be strip the Priv* attributes from the Sinful before using it as a session key.
